body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 爷爷 yéye (paternal grandfather)

body.quiz: Which of the following best describes the word in the audio?
body.answer: 他是我的爸爸的爸爸. Tā shì wǒde bàba de bàba.
options: 她是我的爸爸的妈妈. Tā shì wǒde bàba de māma.
他是我的妈妈的爸爸. Tā shì wǒde māma de bàba.
她是我的妈妈的妈妈. Tā shì wǒde māma de māma.
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 爷爷Yéye refers to paternal grandfather. Therefore, he is your dad’s dad.
body.incorrect: Very close. Think about the meaning of the word in the audio, and then consider the tie the person has with you in the family.

body.textVersion: Audio for 奶奶 nǎinai (paternal grandmother)

body.quiz: Which of the following has the same initial in pinyin as both characters in the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 女儿 nüér (daughter)
options: Audio for 妹妹 mèimei (younger sister)
Audio for 儿子 érzi (son)
Audio for 妈妈 māma (mom)
body.correct: Terrific job! 奶奶nǎinai (paternal grandmother) has initial “n” in pinyin, and so does 女儿nüér (daughter).
body.incorrect: So close! Listen to the audio again to identify the initial of the word; then listen to all options to see which one has the same initial.

body.textVersion: Audio for 外公 wàigōng (maternal grandfather)

body.quiz: Which of the following family members is the spouse of the person referred to by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Outstanding job! 外公wàigōng means “maternal grandfather,” and his spouse should be 外婆wàipó, the maternal grandmother.
body.incorrect: Not quite… listen to the word again, and think about its meaning. Then consider which family member’s title in the choices can be associated.

body.quiz: Which of the following cannot be plural for the word in the audio?
body.correct: Excellently done! The audio “tāmen” means “they,” in which “tā,” verbally, can be “he,” “she,” or “it” with different characters but same pronunciation. Of the four choices, 我wǒ (I) doesn’t fall in the same category.
body.incorrect: So close… focus on the first syllable in the audio, and then consider the character that does not match it. The 2nd syllable “men” is simply the plural for pronouns.
